item.title: Pterostylis pedunculata
item.dc:creator: leuba
item.description: Could not get a shot of leaves or whole plant. Spotted by a walking track -

item.title: Chiloglottis jeanesii
item.dc:creator: leuba
item.description: The flowers in this species were smaller and not as robust as in C. valida which has purplish flowers. The flowers had just a slight tinge of purple and the leaves, that were paired were all green and small. Flower buds (pic 3) were a pale green.

item.title: Poranthera microphylla s.s.
item.dc:creator: leuba
item.description: Herbaceous plant about 5 cm tall with erect stems bearing clusters of small white flowers. Leaves were elongated egg-shaped, some small and some large. The plant had bright green loculated fruit.

item.title: Linum trigynum
item.dc:creator: leuba
item.description: An erect plant about a foot high with thin dichotomous branches. The flowers were very small, about 5 mm wide with bright yellow petals. Leaves were small, lanceolate and some had indented margins. Spotted growing amongst other vegetation like dandelion, sorrel and grass by a walking track, in a national park. It was difficult to see this plant separate to the others growing in the area but the bright yellow flowers looked like little stars suspended amongst tall grass.

item.title: Thelymitra ixioides s.l.
item.dc:creator: leuba
item.description: Tall plant with beautiful blue flowers with purplish tinge ot the outer surface of sepals. Yellow pollinia was visible at the tip of the column. Stigmatic surface showed a dense tuft of white hairs. Leaves were erect and narrow ( not seen here). Spotted in semi-shade in a reserve with eucalypts and natives - dry sclerophyll forest. The flowers bloom in October and November.

item.title: Cornus capitata
item.dc:creator: leuba
item.description: Beautiful, showy white flower heads on a medium-sized tree. the flower heads were on narrow upright stems bearing tight clusters of minute flowers with reduced petals ( pic 5). Each flower head had creamy white bracts - about 4 and sometimes 6. These bracts appeared green on younger flowerheads (pic 4) or tinged with pink (pic 3). Leaves had glossy upper surface. Spotted growing in a reserve in the Dandenong Ranges ( Wet Eucalyptus forest).
